text: Sampled at GABF 2015. In the tasting glass good with a white cap of foam. Nose of citrus and floral hops. Medium body. Flavor is earthy, citrus and floral hops on a caramel malt base. Lightly bitter fruit finish. Good. .

Irving. TX - on tap - FM Smoke Hose. Dark orange pour, slightly hazy with an off-white frothy head, decent lacing. Aroma has a ripening vegetable quality to it, offset by a pleasant fruitiness. Flavor has some peach-like frutiness, just a hint of citrus bitterness and some ripening vegetables in the back end. Mouthfeel is thick enough. Good companion to the beer can chicken I had.

On tap at Square Burger. Pours a deep chopper with a medium white head. The aromas are caramel, light grapefruit, bread. The mouthfeel is dry and slightly bitter with a medium body and good carbonation. Cheers!
Copper color. Earthy spicy hop aroma. A bit thin on the palate. Crisp finish. Light body.

Found old rating. In tap at Live Oak. Pours a clear dark amber color. Foamy head. Aroma is grainy and fairly sweet. Slight earth. Flavor is mainly Caramel upfront with a grainy backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Easy drinking pale ale. Not a lot of hop aroma. Taste cloves a bit. Good for a hot day.

A pretty easy drinking beer from Peticolas. Pours a yellow/gold with white head. Floral, citrus, and earthy on the nose, followed onto the palate. Finishes with a nice compliment of caramel malt that is not overpowering.

Sampled at the 2014 Untapped festival in Fort Worth. Pours near clear amber orange with a tan head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a syrupy grapefruit light citrus and a sweet grain backbone. Flavor has more of a resinous pine with a bit of grapefruit and a sweet grain backbone.
Pours a dark amber color with a medium sized head. Heavy malted caramel nose backed up by fruity esters and some muted citrus. Nice.
Rated at BTBF 2012 (Backlog). Amber in color with an average sized white head. Aroma is of malt, caramel and florals. Taste is of light citrus, malt, herbs.

Clear copper under a thin foamy light beige head. The aroma is a bit faint but has a wee bit of earthy biscuity toffee and a kiss of noble grassy hops. Taste is light and crisp and grassy, with light bitterness throughout and a semi-dry bitter finish. Light grassy and earthy toffee throughout the taste, like the nose.

On tap somewhere in Dallas. I think it was billed as just "Royal", so I am assuming this is it. Had a very nice malt backbone with just enough hops. Nice beer for the style, based on my limited experience with it. Not as hardcore hoppy as an APA, nice texture and nice finish.
fresh at brewery..Pour is copper with a thin head...Nose is nice hop, sweetness, biscuit, caramel...Taste is burnt toffee,spice, nice hop, sweetness, citrus..
Poured a garnet color with no head. Slight hop nose. Mild hop flavours with a hint of caramel malt.
Really flavorful pale ale. Subtle sweet malts on the nose. Light brown sugar, bitter, some hops
On tap. Comes reddish brown with a nice white head. Aroma of malt and pine. Taste is malt, pine, citrus, and caramel. Enjoyed this. Well balanced.

Draft at Flying Saucer The bartender told me this was a Glold Medal beer at the recent competitions. The English Pale Ale pours a deep clear amber with creamy white head. The aroma was of pine resin and earthy. The taste was of resin and fresh citrus. This was an awesome beer that was a joy from beginning to end. The medium body ale had average to high carbonation. Homer recommended this ale. The finish was a winner with lingering bitterness and resin.

Good hoppy version of an EPA. Piney hop aroma at the start. Brown copper color with a nice white head. This was pretty fresh from the growler I picked up earlier in the day so it had a clean crisp palate. Average weight and carbonation. The hops addition took away some of the mellowness I find with most EPAs. Good balance with the hops and malts just not as traditional.

Appearance is a deep orange rust. Caramel palate, malt and corn after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Carmely, toffee brown color. White, oily head. Smells like... cant smell much, maybe a little wood and metal, or maybe thats whats on my brain. The bite is strong and the flavor bitter toffee and caramel. Could have been a decent bitter except the abv is way to high to enjoy this in any sort of non-alcoholic way. At least its bitter. That bite is just a bit stiff. Complexity is what its got going for it.

Pours a hazy to the point of opaqueness honey golden with a light golden tan head. Malty aroma has a throng overtone of banana with a snippet of apple. Flavor has a malty core and fruity and subtle hoppy notes. Firm, smooth mouthfeel has a persistent tingle. Scandalous? Who gives a rats a** - this is a decent beer!

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2013 on tap at Henrys Tavern in Plano.   dark amberpour with long white lacing.  In a bar; no armoa   Flavor was nicely balanced mix of malts, toffe, nuts and sharp bitterness.  Only had a couple beers from Peticolas but they were both good brews.

Love the brewery and all of their beers. I think this is my favorite. Drank from a Growler 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampled on the Beerliner at GABF. A really solid English pale. Was truly English in ingredients. Hops lurked in the background while the malt and yeast took center stage. First beer from Pericolas!
Tap at Oak St.  Hazy brown pour with a decent white head and nice lacing. Aroma is sweet malt and some grass. Taste is caramel with some citrus. Nice bitterness to balance the malt. Pretty good.
(draught) clear medium amber, creamy light tan head. Nose of English hops, candied citrus, juicy orange and more citrus. Taste of caramel, fresh grain, cream, fairly hoppy, better as it warms.

Really flavorful pale ale. Subtle sweet malts on the nose. Light brown sugar, bitter, some hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Common Table. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aromas of citrus, esters, grain, and citrusy hops. Flavors of grains, bread, citrus, and some hop bitterness. Was a little sweet and grainy.

On tap at BTBF. The smell is fruit, mostly grapefruits, hops, yeast, and some malts.  The look is cloudy, orange colored, with a light white head.  The taste is light bitterness, malts, grainy, and some hops.

On tap. Pours deep gold/amber with creamy off-white head. Aroma of pine and earth with hints of caramel and bread. Flavor is much the same with a pleasant, sharp bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium body, soft body with medium-high carbonation. Overall, very solid brew!

On tap at Holy Grail. Pours with a clearish golden hued body with a small off-white head that lasts. Aromas are malty, honey, estery, caramel, malty, light herbal hops and toasty. Flavors are of cereal, mild copper/metal, sweet, caramel, mild esters, pears. Lively bubbles, medium dry.

On tap at the Big Texas Beer Fest.

The beer pours a hazy golden color with a medium-sized white head. The aroma is pretty hoppy, with a nice mix of English and American hops. I get some nice earth and grass notes, as well as some orange citrus. There is also a little bit of biscuit malt in the aroma. The flavor is more of the same, with the earth and grass hops flavors, as well as a little bit of bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Poured at the Big Texas Beer Festival.  Light pour with a white head.  Aroma is light fruit, earth, and grain.  Taste is bitter toasted bread, floral, and light spices.

On tap @ BTBF.
Bright amber brew with a creamy white head.  Aromas of bready and caramel malt, floral and pine hops.  Big time floral hop flavor with some caramel and grassy hops.  Crazy balanced and easy to drink.  Peticolas really knows how to make balanced, drinkable beers.

(Draught)  Pours a hazy golden body with a small white head.  Aroma of citrus, florals, citrus, herbs, and grass.  Flavor of grass, citrus, light biscuit, earthiness, and some florals with a moderately bitter finish.
on tap at BTBF, amber color with tall tan foam, aroma of caramel and toffee, flavor is slight bitter, nuts, toffee, malty , leather, soft finish
crisp amber pour with a cream head.  nose is rich malts, dough, toffee, caramel, and sticky.  great on the palate, huge malts, bread, toffee, very well balanced, and a smooth finish.

Tap at the moth Dallas. Hazy light brown with a small head. Nose is very 
Mild hops and a tinge of maltiness. Nice mellow hop profile that drinks like a mild. Hint of alcohol. Smooth.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA
